column1: This set is great for a first Minecraft set, which is why I got this one first.
column3: t let the title deceive you. &nbsp
column4: There are a few issues with the set, but overall this looks like what a Minecraft player would build in the first day of mining and crafting in order to survive the first night.

column1: The box was bigger than I thought it would be, which was a good sign considering that bigger boxes mean bigger sets.
column2: It showed all of the function that this set had.

column1: With 408 pieces, this set was divided into 3 or 4 bags(I don'
column3: As I was looking at some of the pieces, like the crafting table pieces and furnace and stone brick/oak plank parts, I saw all of the detail on them.

column1: 3 minifigures(not micro thank god) come with this set.
column2: Steve, who is the default skin in Minecraft, has his usual cyan shirt(although it looked more light blue) with blue pants(though they look more dark purplish-blue) and a happy smile. &nbsp
column3: He comes with 3 weapons: a wooden sword(shown on the front of the box), wooden axe(to chop down trees), and a wooden pickaxe(for mining stone). &nbsp
column4: The only things I would change about Steve are the hues of his clothing, and the color of his eyes. &nbsp
column5: In this set and others, his eyes are a blackish-purple haze instead of blue like they are in the game. &nbsp
column6: The final thing I would change about Steve is the arms. &nbsp
column7: In Minecraft, Steve has a short-sleeve shirt on, which means some skin is visible. &nbsp

column11: This was possible, because they did shorten the sleeves of Bart and Homer Simpson from 71006 The Simpsons House. &nbsp
column12: Hopefully in future Minecraft sets, LEGO will fit Steve with shorter sleeves.

column1: The build took 65 minutes for me to complete.
column3: It was as if Steve was building his house! &nbsp
column4: I was surprised but happy to see that there were no stickers included, which meant that every detail colored detail on the pieces were printed!

column2: If you pick it up from 1 end, another section comes apart. &nbsp
column4: You build the terrain around his house(which in this case is grass) with a few flowers here and there and an oak tree!

column2: s house has an attached wooden fence on the side(with a fence gate) where Steve can keep his pig. &nbsp
column3: There are glass windows all around, and what amazed me the most was the stone and stone brick features on the perimeter of the house. &nbsp
column4: TRULY amazing what LEGO did with that! &nbsp
column5: In the front of the house, there&#39
column6: s a wooden door that Steve can use to go in and out of his house. &nbsp
column8: s a crafting table, large chest, bed, furnace, and some wooden plank detail. &nbsp
column9: Right next to his bed on the wall is an area to hang the wooden pickaxe. &nbsp
column10: The set also comes with a long piece of bread, which can be put in the large chest, as well as 2 torches, 1 for outside &amp
column12: What could be better about the torches is if they lit up like the ender crystals from 21117 The Ender Dragon.

column1: My overall opinion on this set is 4/5 stars.
